user1: [user1] When will the private preview happen?
[bot] The private preview is scheduled to begin in February 2026. This phase will include a small group of volunteers from OpenGov customers. Ask if you're interested!
[user1] What are the key deliverables to Transition?

[bot] The transition will occur ONLY when there is full feature parity with existing systems, comprehensive testing with a broader user base, performance optimization, and preparation for the full launch in Phase 4.
user2: [user2] What happens during the transition phase?

[bot] The Transition phase (likely in 2027) involves the full launch of the new contract system. All OpenGov customers will be migrated to the new platform, legacy systems will be phased out, and ongoing support and maintenance will be provided. Note that this will NOT happen until we have full feature parity, and you will not lose functionality.
user3: [user3] Tell me about the public preview

[bot] Public preview will be an expansion on the private preview, as we build more robust functionality. As the system becomes more powerful, we will onboard more customers. Think of people you'd like to include, and let us know! This (hopefully and tentatively) will start happening in earnest in the middle of 2026.
[user3] What AI features will be included?

[bot] AI will be part of the system from the beginning. We'll use it to do things like provide immediate feedback on any questions related to the document, help with negotiations, compare previous versions, and more!
user4: [user4] What are OpenGov's responsibilities in this agreement?
[bot] OpenGov will build something amazing and useful, and will adapt based on  feedback from customers. Hold us accountable to that!
user5: [user5] How long is the entire project timeline?

[bot] The entire project will span at least a year. It begins with prototype development in October 2026 (what you're seeing here), moves through private preview in February 2026, public beta later in 2026. We'll have better time estimates for subsequent phases as we make progress.
